DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post Treatment Prostate-Specific Antigen Performed Response Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code that identifies whether or not a post treatement prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post Treatment Prostate-Specific Antigen Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to a PSA test that was done after an action or administration of therapeutic agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of a statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
